instName: ﻿Church of our Lady of Mount Carmel

persNote: ﻿This Gentleman attends a very large mission in the Upper Counties of the State
NOTES: ﻿https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dardenne_Prairie,_Missouri ; https://genealogytrails.com/mo/stcharles/hist_towns.htm ; These sources say that the present church did not open until 1880, so it is hard to say where this church actually was

﻿https://icnewmadrid.com/church-history ; 1833 almanac mentions no name for the church, but the 1860s/70s almanacs mention a St. John. The church site says that said church(es) came after the war. This means that this one in the 1833 almanac is likely the precursor.
﻿There are too many in later years to say definitively which one this refers to. For that reason, I am leaving it as a generic 9000 ID.
﻿As above, I don't think that there is any clear case for this being one specific place that shows up later in the 1860s/1870s diocese.

﻿Source says the present church was built in 1860, but it stands to reason that if the record goes back this far, another structure stood here before the one still standing. Same name, same location: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Paul_Catholic_Church_(Center,_Missouri)

courses: ﻿The Mercantile Department embraces, Reading, Writing, the English and French Languages, Poetry, Rhetoric, History, Geography, Mythology, Book-Keep-ing, Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, the use of the Globes, Trigonometry, Mensuration, and Surveying. The Classical Department, besides the above specified subjects, comprises the Latin and Greek Languages, Logic, Metaphysics, Moral and Natural Philo-sophy, and the higher branches of the Mathematics. The Spanish, if required, is taught to the students of both departments, without any additional charge. The English is the ordinary language of communcation in all the classes, the French and Spanish ex-cepted; but the students speak French and English in-discriminately, during the hours of recreation.

NOTES: ﻿https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Mary%27s_of_the_Barrens_Catholic_Church_(Perryville,_Missouri) ; St. Mary of the Barrens (Perry County, Missouri) - Missouri Life TV Season 5 - YouTube
